Sen. Schumer's seventh amendment is short but important: the President doesn't get to pick & choose which evidence he provides to the Senate. If he wants docs admitted, he must turn over everything asked for in the subpoena. This helps prevent selective admission of evidence.

The Sixth Amendment provides the accused the right "to have the Assistance of Counsel for his defense." Note that the Sixth Amendment does not apply to the prosecution; it protects only the accused.
